content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map during these execution steps. The agent repeatedly attempted to locate, craft, and place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) to supply Automation Science Packs for research. All such attempts have failed because the required Lab item was missing and the necessary sub-ingredients were not available. In parallel, the agent referenced pre‐existing furnace entities (an iron furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) used for smelting iron ore into iron plates and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) used for smelting copper ore into copper plates). These furnaces were simply utilized for processing raw materials rather than newly constructed.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage Errors
 – Incorrectly calling get_entities with unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. using “radius”) or extra positional arguments caused type errors. Use the correct function signature and pass only supported arguments.

• Inventory and Placement Issues
 – Attempts to place a Lab failed because no Lab item was available in the inventory. Verify resource availability before initiating placement.

• Null Iteration Problems
 – Iterating over the result of get_entities without checking for a None value produced errors. Always validate that the returned value is iterable.

• Crafting and Dependency Shortfalls
 – Lab crafting errors arose from missing sub-ingredients such as iron-gear-wheels and electronic-circuits (which themselves require sufficient iron-plates, copper-plates, and copper-cables). Ensure that every item in the production chain is available in the required quantities before attempting complex recipes.
